posts.post_content:
Water magic draining mana from your enemy seems pretty blue to me.
  
Not the most useful thing ever printed. But in a deck built purely to annoy the \*\*\* out of other players, instead of actually winning the game, a few of these can come in handy.

Posted By: MetalCrisis (4/30/2009 4:01:44 PM)

posts.post_content:
"*Not the most useful thing*"? This card is bad as hell.  
Probably the worst land destruction ever printed.  
It's off color, yes, but nobody would want to play a ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) [Stone Rain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stone Rain) which won't take effect until waiting for your opponent's turn at first, and even then he/she can still decide to pay ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol) **or** 1 life to stafe off the loss for another turn.  
Just a horribly bad card. 0,5/5
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
So basically, your opponent either has to let the land go or pay 1 to keep it around.   
  
Not exactly threatening, especially since they can pay a single life and keep it around for almost forever.
